<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 209]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 233]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 352, 828, 368]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 495, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 433]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 448, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 495]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 97, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 917, 102]]<|/det|>
A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{4}{7 - 2x}\) . The point (3, 2) lies on the curve. Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 95, 920, 114]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 141, 97, 160]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 140, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|x - 8| > |2x - 4|.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 142, 920, 161]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 189, 97, 207]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 189, 920, 224]]<|/det|>
(i) The polynomial \(2x^{3} + ax^{2} - ax - 12\), where \(a\) is a constant, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \((x + 1)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). Find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 207, 920, 225]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 235, 153, 254]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 234, 752, 254]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) has this value, find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 3)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 237, 920, 255]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 282, 96, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 282, 541, 301]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(5^{y + 1} = 2^{3x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 314, 151, 333]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 314, 742, 333]]<|/det|>
By taking logarithms, show that the graph of \(y\) against \(x\) is a straight line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 314, 920, 333]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 345, 151, 364]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 344, 920, 378]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the gradient of this line and state the coordinates of the point at which the line cuts the \(y\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 361, 920, 380]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 407, 96, 426]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 407, 331, 426]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 427, 576, 447]]<|/det|>
\[x^{2} - 2x^{2}y + 3y = 9.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 467, 153, 486]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 465, 371, 495]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{2x - 4xy}{2x^2 - 3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 470, 920, 489]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 505, 153, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 505, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(x = 2\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 523, 920, 542]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 568, 96, 587]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 568, 154, 587]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 567, 650, 587]]<|/det|>
By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 592, 551, 612]]<|/det|>
\[3\mathrm{e}^{x} = 8 - 2x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 621, 304, 640]]<|/det|>
has only one root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 621, 920, 640]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 651, 151, 670]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 650, 698, 670]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that this root lies between \(x = 0.7\) and \(x = 0.8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 651, 920, 670]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 682, 151, 700]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 682, 520, 700]]<|/det|>
Show that this root also satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 705, 569, 739]]<|/det|>
\[x = \ln \left(\frac{8 - 2x}{3}\right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 714, 920, 733]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 769, 151, 787]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 763, 920, 800]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = \ln \left(\frac{8 - 2x_{n}}{3}\right)\) to determine this root correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 794, 576, 813]]<|/det|>
Give the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 794, 920, 812]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the region bounded by the curve \(y = 1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x - 1}\), the \(x\)-axis and the lines \(x = \frac{1}{2}\) and \(x = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 121, 146, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 131, 712, 295]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 312, 920, 358]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{2x}}{\sin 2x}\) for \(0 < x < \frac{1}{2}\pi\), and its minimum point \(M\). Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 343, 920, 361]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 387, 96, 406]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 387, 303, 406]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label> Prove the identity

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 406, 920, 440]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{\sin(x - 60^{\circ}) + \cos(x - 30^{\circ})} \equiv \cos \mathrm{ec} x. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 457, 153, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 457, 363, 475]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 483, 667, 515]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{2}{\sin(x - 60^{\circ}) + \cos(x - 30^{\circ})} = 3\cot^{2}x - 2,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 521, 304, 540]]<|/det|>
for \(0^{\circ}< x< 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 523, 920, 542]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
